ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it only to those interested in fluid-dynamics

Overall a very good class, contains solid introduction part as well as some advances topics. Instructor explains material well and in a comprehensive way. One would get an understanding of basic ideas and problems in the field of turbulence.

The course provides a comprehensive overview of turbulence phenomena, challenges, past and current methods for solving them. This course is rewarding, because the lectures are clear and the instructor is extremely helpful. I would recommend the class to students with a background in fluid mechanics, who want to learn the fundamental physics behind turbulence and develop a new way of thinking.

I would summarize it as course that gives you a good idea, without the need of getting into a too complicated reasoning (i.e. avoiding complex math, etc), about a broad range of aspects of turbulence, and I would definitely recommend it to a fellow student because it helped me clarify my previous ideas about the subject.
I did not find that course required much prior knowledge of fluid dynamics, so I would recommend it to anyone planning to do research in a related field.
Would recommend without any hesitation. Excellent course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: it was a subject I always studied superficially. the course gave me many more details.
This course was directly applicable to my dissertation topic, and gave me the opportunity to explore it in a paper presentation.
